intro: Heisteria macroceras, commonly known as the showy heister, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture, and its stems are often covered in fine, white pubescence. Heisteria macroceras thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. It is a perennial herb that can grow up to 3 feet tall, making it a notable addition to native plant gardens.
